reviews.text: good location. less than one minute to two tube stations, eateries including MacDonald, Burger King, Subway, Tesco, Sainsbury etc.
reviews.title: good location but cheap in all other aspects

reviews.text: Bad sides: extremely small rooms. very few amenities. Free wifi only in lobby. otherwise 6 £ /day with cable. taxi that the hotel suggested would have been 95£ to Stansted but we found one with minicab for 57£. Noisy rooms when people go through corridors.
reviews.title: Executive???

reviews.text: Good Points: Clean, reasonable size, close to Underground and restaurants.
reviews.title: Cheap but always cheerful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad Points: All apartments have one small double bed. Not the ideal situation for friends. Being a mother/daughter combination we coped. There was no indication in their advertisement that only double beds were available.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: Kitchen equipped with crockery, cutlery, pots, pans and dish washing liquid. When I asked reception about a tea towel or sponge were told "we only supply towels" so that is what we used!
reviews.title: Good for a short stay, but can see the negatives...

reviews.text: We booked this 'apartment' that sleeps 4 as two couples, actually it's only one room so not great for four adults! One couple alone ended up staying due to this, making it a pretty pricey hotel room. No breakfast of course. The website boasts 'everything you would expect from a modern well appointed apartment' but there's no hairdryer, no clock or radio, no phone, only 3 channels on the tv which you can't easily see unless you stand in the doorway, no water glasses, one bedside lamp which didn't work.
reviews.title: Never mind luxury, missing the basics!

reviews.text: I admit its pretty central but we've stayed centrally for half the price in business type hotels before, and at least you have basic amenities. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable but that's the best it gets.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: We don't expect a lot from a hotel but this left us very disappointed.
reviews.title: I would prefer to sleep in a bus shelter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 3 nights at the apartments in Hyde Park. The location was excellent and just 2 mins from the nearest tube station. We had a basement room that's window looked onto a courtyard and passed by other guests so the blind had to be kept down at all times. The room was clean and modern but a little stuffy being in the basement. The staff were friendly and helpful the only real downside was that the bed and pillows were really very uncomfortable. Great value for the location but would probably look to stay elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: Great Location- shame about the bed

reviews.text: Where do i start.... First of all it was not an apartment but a tiny room with a sink in the corner, the bed was not a double as it said it was only a little bigger than a single. The en suite was ok but no bath only a shower & everything in room was from ikea- not 4* material.
reviews.title: I would not recomended this hotel at all

reviews.text: The reviews scared me, I must admit. As someone who doesn't have the funds to travel regularly, I wanted to ensure I got a place I was happy and comfortable with. I took the gamble on HPEA despite the reviews and I am so glad I did.
reviews.title: As good as it gets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based mere seconds from an entrance to Hyde Park itself (as in, you genuinely step out the front door, turn left and about 100 steps directly in front of you is said entrance); as well as one street away from two tube stations servicing three lines, the location is simply as good as it gets. Genuinely, you are at the heart of everything from these apartments and it was delightful knowing I was a maximum of 40 minutes away from anywhere worth seeing in London.
reviews.title: Excellent location - best in class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for my stay itself. I arrived and was rather pleased to hear I had been upgraded, free of charge, to one of their club rooms. I had paid for the medium luxury suite so obviously, the upgrade was more than welcome. My room was spotless, modern and very nicely designed. It was better than any hotel room I've stayed in. They don't provide you with much, it being a self-service apartment, but you do get washing up liquid, a safe, iron and ironing board and towels. However, Tesco and Sainsbury's (as well as several other stores) are right around the corner.
reviews.title: Executive they are not!!!

reviews.text: I cannot praise this room highly enough. There was not a single fault with it and I did try find one. The bed was comfortable, the lighting was nice, the TV was modern, as were the kitchen appliances and the decor was classy.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.text: The reception staff are a delight too. I had an unfortunate incident where I knocked over a vase in the room by accident and panicking, I went straight to reception to ask if I could replace it but instead they were ludicrously kind and calm about it and that was the general attitude from them for the duration of my week long stay. They were always kind and willing to help.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was quite concerned after easing other reviews but worked well for us. Not an apartment as such small room with facilities. Microwave combined, fridge hob assorted utensils. Sink iron small ironing board. Queen size bed NOT 3/4 as suggested.
reviews.title: Fit for purpose

reviews.text: Very clean good shower /toilet facilities . Towels and shampoo, shower gel supplied. Granted no hair dryer.
reviews.title: Clean, Great Location, Teeny Tiny Apartment!

reviews.text: For the price ,especially in such a good area , fab value for money and the staff are very helpful . Would stay again for few days , don't think it's too good if you want to stay for longer periods as may get a little claustrophobic but have stayed in smaller hotel rooms at a greater price.!
reviews.title: Great hotel, horrible staff, fantastic location

reviews.text: I travel to London on business regularly and have stayed in many different hotels and apartments. I booked these I had to travel at short notice and my preferred accommodation was not available. The price seemed too good to be true - and it was!
reviews.title: Gets extra point for location!!

reviews.text: The staff were very friendly, the apartment exceptionally clean, however I really struggle to understand how they are allowed to describe this as an executive apartment. It was advertised as being their largest apartment and suitable for up to four people. The apartment was tiny!! I had booked for only 2 people but instead of their being a sofa in the kitchen/living area there a double camping style bed that had been made up - this did not convert into a sofa! There is only a hob and microwave for cooking so you really cannot self cater properly!
reviews.title: Great
